pullRequest.title: Fully remove stream and result listeners
pullRequest.bodyText:
Addresses issue #212.
ResultListener and StreamListener have been decomposed into functional interfaces,
Consumer<T> and Action. The public APIs have been changed to use the new
interfaces.
This change takes it a step further, fully removing ResultListener and StreamListener from the code base, prefering Consumer<T> and `Action for internal uses, too.
By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.

commit.message:
Fully remove ResultListener and StreamListener from code base

These have been decomposed into functional interfaces,
Consumer<SomeType> and Action. Just use these directly, internally,
instead.
